mods.abstract: Notice. THE following named negroes have been placed in my care by order of his Excellency H.W. Allen, Governor of Louisiana: Negro woman ELIZABETH, dark complexion; aged about 40 years. Said to belong to Evan Jeffries, Claibourn county Mississippi. PETER, aged 50 years; ELIZA, 45 years ; CHARLOTTE, 38 years; ELLEN, 25 years ; JANE, 18 years and DARCUS, 20 years; allof dark complexion. Said to belong to the Estate of Claudius Johnson, parish of Tensas, La. Negro girl PATSY, aged about 12 years, Judat, about 10 years; Hester, about 10 years ; Trice about 8 years and Jack a boy about 10 years old ; all of dark complexion. Said to belong to George Marshall, near Natchez, Mississippi. Negro woman MARTHA, of black complexion, aged about 38 years. Said to belong to James N. Gwin, Homes county Mississippi. Negro man LOUIS, dark complexion ; aged about 49 years. Said to belong to Messrs. Warfield & Tibbetts, Homes county Miss. Negro boy FRANK, dark complexion; aged about 10 years, belongs to Mr. Duncan, near Waterproof, La. The said boy is now sick at the house of Capt. A. H. Payne, in Claiborn parish, La. RILEY, a negro boy of dark complesion; aged about 16 years. Said to belong to Mrs. Anna Covington, near Waterproof, Louisiana. MARIA, a negro girl; aged about 17 years, and NANCY, aged about 12 years ; both of dark complesion. Said to belong to William Carter, of Madison parish, La. SUSAN, negro girl of dark complexion ; aged about 18 yers an AMOS, a boy of light complexion ; aged about 5 years. Said to belong to Alfred Davis, Natchez, Miss. MARY, a negro woman of dark complexion, aged about 45 years. Said to belong to Mrs. Catherin Eurtis, Isequena county, Miss. MARY, a negro woman, aged about 25 years, and her male child about one year old. CEILY, a woman, aged about 55 years. TARPER, a boy about 10 years. HENRIETTA, a girl about 8 years; SUSAN, a girl about 5 years; HENRY, a boy about 14 years; SARAH, a girl, about 18 years ; VINA, a girl about 6 years, and PATSY, girl, about 3 years. Said to belong to Robert Turnbull, Isequena conuty, Miss. ELLICK, a negro boy, black complesion; aged about 18 years. Said to belong to Elijah Shuttleworth, state of Mississippi. The owner can recover the same by proof of Title and paying charges. TEMPLE S. COONS, Commissioner. Shereveport, July 30th. 1864 Aug2-tf
mods.note: Evan Jeffries; Claudius Johnson; George Marshall; James N. Gwin; Messrs. Warfield & Tibbetts; Mr. Duncan; Mrs. Anna Covington; William Carter; Alfred Davis; Mrs. Catherin Eurtis; Robert Turnbull; Elijah Shuttleworth

Elizabeth (40); Peter (50); Eliza (45); Charlotte (38); Ellen (25); Jane (18); Darcus (20); Patsy (12); Judat (10); Hester (10); Trice (8); Jack (10); Martha (38); Louis (49); FRANK (10); Riley (16); Maria (17); Nanyc (12); Susan (18); Amos (5); Mary (45); Mary (25); male child (1); Ceily (55); Tarper (10); Henrietta (8); Susan (5); Henry (14); Sarah (18); Vina (6); Patsy (3); Ellick (18)

mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
